newsitem.title: UK: Islam is victim of Algeria bloodshed - FIS leader.
newsitem.headline: Islam is victim of Algeria bloodshed - FIS leader.

text.p: The leader of the banned Islamic Salvation Front (FIS) Abassi Madani said in remarks published on Thursday that Islam was a victim and not a perpetrator of the bloodshed in Algeria.
"It is not possible that Islam be accused of what is happening," Madani said in remarks published in the London-based Al-Hayat newspaper.
"If I say Islam is innocent, then this means that Islam was accused. Islam itself is what is being slaughtered...
"How can the victim be the criminal? I can't say the lamb devours the wolf. It's the wolf who devours the lamb. What concerns us is adhering to our behaviour under Islamic law."
Hundreds of civilians, including babies and pregnant women, have been killed in Algeria this year in massacres blamed by the authorities on Moslem rebels.
About 60,000 people have been killed in the conflict between the government and the Islamists since 1992 when the authorities cancelled a general election in which FIS had taken a commanding lead.

Madani was arrested in 1991 and sentenced in 1992 by a military court to 12 years in jail for threatening Algeria's security. He was set free on parole in July halfway through the sentence and told to refrain from political activity.
Madani said after his release that he and his supporters would do all they could to end the violence.
Al-Hayat quoted Madani as saying that what is happening in Algeria "is a repeat of what took place in Bosnia. Moslems are the victims".
He denied that he was seeking to take refuge in Morocco.
"I have neither the intention nor the ability, because I am concerned with the issue of the suffering of our people. There is no sleep when I hear what is happening."
